channel.title: Cointelegraph.com News
channel.description: Cointelegraph covers fintech, blockchain and Bitcoin bringing you the latest crypto news and analyses on the future of money.

image.title: Cointelegraph.com News
image.description: Cointelegraph covers fintech, blockchain and Bitcoin bringing you the latest crypto news and analyses on the future of money.

item.title: Caroline Ellison’s list of ‘Things Sam Is Freaking Out About’ could be used in trial
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Tom Mitchelhill
item.category: Things Sam Is Freaking Out About
item.description: The prosecution intends to use Caroline Ellison's personal memos alongside a trove of other evidence against Sam Bankman-Fried at his criminal trial.

item.title: Silvergate CEO to depart amid ongoing liquidation and investor suits
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Felix Ng
item.description: Silvergate is losing its CEO Alan Lane and two other top executives as part of an ongoing wind-down of the once crypto-friendly bank.

item.title: Donald Trump’s Ethereum wallet holds $2.8M, new statement shows
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Brayden Lindrea
item.description: The recent disclosure ups the figure disclosed in earlier records which said Trump held between $250,000 to $500,000 in an Ethereum wallet.

item.title: Illuvium's collapsing token represents the problems with GameFi
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Takuya Tsuji
item.description: GameFi developers have been focused on raking in money — and they've forgotten that they need to make games fun in order to win over players.

item.title: Bitcoin price action is beginning to mirror BTC’s 2015-2017 pre-bull market cycle
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Marcel Pechman
item.description: Bitcoin’s price action and the crypto markets’ structure are beginning to mirror the pre-bull run activity seen in previous years, according to Delphi Digital.

item.title: US lawmakers press SEC and FINRA on Prometheum’s broker-dealer approval
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Turner Wright
item.description: Members of the House Financial Services Committee questioned the “timing and circumstances” of FINRA approving Prometheum’s special purpose broker-dealer license in May.

item.title: Coinbase political initiative features US lawmaker who admitted to ethics violations
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Turner Wright
item.description: Rep. David Schweikert, featured as a lawmaker “very supportive” of crypto in the United States, paid $175,000 as part of a settlement related to violations of House ethics rules.

item.title: Is Bitcoin’s record-low volatility and decline in short-term holders a bull market signal?
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Marcel Pechman
item.description: Traders believe that Bitcoin’s low volatility is a bull market signal, but their bias could be preventing them from acknowledging potentially negative macro outcomes.

item.title: Breaking: Binance Connect shutting down on Aug. 16
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Zhiyuan Sun
item.description: A spokesperson said the move came in response to “changing market and user needs.”

item.title: 11 potential impacts on crypto and the market from the rise of CBDCs
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Cointelegraph Innovation Circle
item.description: The ultimate impacts of CBDCs on the crypto industry may be a mixed bag of positives and negatives, and insiders need to monitor developments.

item.title: BTC price can reach $34K as Bitcoin faces support ‘kiss’ — QCP Capital
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By William Suberg
item.description: Bitcoin lacks major volatility catalysts, but a classic support bounce could spark the return of the highest BTC prices in over a year, one analysis predicts.

item.title: Why is Bitcoin price stuck?
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Yashu Gola
item.category: why is bitcoin price not moving
item.description: Bitcoin price is stuck today, but a narrowing Bollinger Bands indicator suggests that a big move is brewing.

item.title: Sei token valued at $1.8B after beta launch, exchange listings
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Zhiyuan Sun
item.description: The token opened to a wild trading session across major exchanges.

item.title: Perfect storm for undervalued ASICs: Blockstream plans $50M raise to buy miners
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Gareth Jenkinson
item.description: Blockstream intends to buy and store ASIC mining hardware ahead of Bitcoin’s halving in 2024.

item.title: Here’s what happened in crypto today
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Serge Egon Ostman
item.category: why did the Fed pause rates
item.description: Need to know what happened in crypto today? Here is the latest news on daily trends and events impacting Bitcoin price, blockchain, DeFi, NFTs, Web3 and crypto regulation.

item.title: Big Questions: Did the NSA create Bitcoin?
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Felix Ng
item.description: Is Bitcoin the biggest intel honeypot in history? A former NSA agent says “they absolutely have the capability” but others ridicule the idea.

item.title: China’s new AI regulations begin to take effect
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Savannah Fortis
item.description: The Chinese government has loosened the original guidelines for AI it released in April and scheduled them to take effect starting Aug. 15.

item.title: How to protect your privacy online
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Alice Ivey
item.description: Discover effective strategies to maintain online privacy and learn how to safeguard your personal information while navigating the digital landscape.

item.title: SEC delays set deadlines for Bitcoin ETF approval to early 2024
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Turner Wright
item.description: With a maximum 240-day window available to the SEC to delay crypto ETF applications, some firms could wait until March 2024 to hear decisions on filings made in July 2023.

item.title: Your rights in the metaverse: The benefits and challenges of collaborating in the digital age
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Anthony Georgiades
item.description: Collective creativity and shared ownership of content in the metaverse raise considerations regarding fair use, credit and compensation for creative contributions.

item.title: Mining service provider faces $100M lawsuit over pyramid scheme allegations in China
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ezra Reguerra
item.description: Prosecutors alleged that the executives of a Filecoin mining project orchestrated an elaborate pyramid scheme and scammed the participants.

item.title: Prime Trust bankruptcy spotted by crypto community months ahead
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Savannah Fortis
item.description: Months before Prime Trust filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy, online sleuths in the crypto community were on the case and continue to follow the money.

item.title: First EU spot Bitcoin ETF hits Euronext Amsterdam exchange
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Gareth Jenkinson
item.description: The Jacobi Bitcoin ETF is finally going live on the Euronext Amsterdam stock exchange, more than a year after its planned launch.

item.title: BTC price won’t hit $100K before 2024 halving — Bitcoin investment exec
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By William Suberg
item.description: Bitcoin halving data will not be reflected in the market for a year or more, says Jesse Myers.

item.title: Bitcoin Depot Q2 revenue jumps 18% YOY, eyes growth after Nasdaq listing
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Gareth Jenkinson
item.description: Bitcoin Depot records $197.5 million in revenue in the second quarter of 2023, spurred on by partnerships with various U.S. retail stores.

item.title: New Zealand crypto exchange Dasset enters liquidation
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By David Attlee
item.description: Customers of Auckland-headquartered crypto exchange have been denied access to their funds.

item.title: Singapore central bank says three business days is ‘timely transfer’ for stablecoins
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ezra Reguerra
item.description: Redemptions of MAS-regulated single-currency stablecoins will have a longer grace period of five business days despite some arguing that it should be done in real time.

item.title: What are crypto-backed mortgages, and how do they work?
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Jagjit Singh
item.description: Crypto-backed mortgages involve using cryptocurrency holdings as collateral to secure loans, offering benefits like access to liquidity without selling assets.

item.title: Dubai lures AI, Web3 enterprises with 90% subsidized commercial licenses
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Arijit Sarkar
item.description: In addition to attracting talent, Dubai has also given out operational licenses to crypto exchanges over the past several months.

item.title: Singapore central bank releases regulatory framework for stablecoins
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Jesse Coghlan
item.description: The framework outlines requirements for stablecoin issuers to meet to be deemed as regulated by the Monetary Authority of Singapore.
